meanings.definition: A person who is not chosen or authorized to represent others.
meanings.sent1: The nondelegate watched the meeting from the back of the room.
meanings.sent2: The nondelegate did not have the power to make decisions on behalf of the group.
meanings.sent3: The nondelegate jokingly pretended to be the boss for a day.
meanings.sent4: In the land of the nondelegates, everyone had to speak for themselves.
meanings.sent5: The role of a nondelegate is to observe and learn from others.

meanings.definition: To not assign or transfer authority to another person.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to nondelegate the task to the new employee.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to nondelegate responsibilities without proper training.
meanings.sent3: The team leader chose to nondelegate the decision-making process to the team members.
meanings.sent4: She felt overwhelmed and wished she could nondelegate some of her duties.
meanings.sent5: The CEO made a strategic choice to nondelegate certain tasks to focus on key priorities.
